Activity

To make a quilt, a quilter is buying fabric in two colors, light and dark. He needs at least 9.5 yards of fabric in total.

The light color costs $9 a yard. The dark color costs $13 a yard. The quilter can spend up to $110 on fabric.


Here are two graphs that represent the two constraints.

  1. Length

  1. Cost 


  1. Write an inequality to represent the length constraint. Let \(x\) represent the yards of light fabric and \(y\) represent the yards of dark fabric.

Enter your answer here:

Your answers may vary, but here are some sample responses to compare your answers.

\(x+y\geq9.5\) or equivalent


  1. Select all the pairs that satisfy the length constraint.
    • \((5,5)\)
    • \((2.5,4.5)\)
    • \((7.5,3.5)\)
    • \((12,10)\)

Enter your answer here:

\((5,5)\), \((7.5,3.5)\), and \((12,10)\)


  1. Write an inequality to represent the cost constraint.

Enter your answer here:

Your answers may vary, but here are some sample responses to compare your answers.

\(9x+13y\leq110\) or equivalent 


  1. Select all the pairs that satisfy the cost constraint.
    • \((1,1)\)
    • \((4,5)\)
    • \((8,3)\)
    • \((10,1)\)

Enter your answer here:

\((1,1)\), \((4,5)\), and \((10,1)\)


  1. Explain why \((2,2)\) satisfies the cost constraint but not the length constraint.

Enter your answer here:

Your answers may vary, but here are some sample responses to compare your answers.

2 yards of each color costs $44, which is less than $110, so it satisfies this constraint. However, this is only 4 yards altogether, which is not at least 9.5 yards.


  1. Find at least one pair of numbers that satisfies both constraints. Be prepared to explain how you know.

Enter your answer here:

Your answers may vary, but here are some sample responses to compare your answers.

Sample responses: \((10,1)\), \((8,2)\), and (\(6.5,3.5)\) (any point that is in the intersection of the two inequalities).


  1. What does the pair of numbers represent in this situation?

Enter your answer here:

Your answers may vary, but here are some sample responses to compare your answers.

For example: \((10,1)\) means 10 yards of light fabric and 1 yard of dark fabric. This is 11 yards of fabric altogether, which is more than 9.5. It costs $103 because \(9(10)+1(13)=103\). This is less than the $110 maximum.


  1. Write the two inequalities together as a system of inequalities.

Enter your answer here:

\(\left\{\begin{array}{l}9x+13y\leq110\\x+y\geq9.5\end{array}\right.\) or equivalent
